content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the taurage district court the court reached a final resolution in a matrimonial property case dissolving the marriage and awarding the defendant with an audi and peugeot vehicle the court divided the obligations related to the use of the vehicles employment service and state tax inspectorate between the applicant and the defendant various articles of the civil code were discussed including establishing the balance of assets determining their value deviation of equal shares in community property and shareable property the court received a revised claim from the plaintiff seeking dissolution of the marriage division of property and recognition of personal debts the defendant disagreed with the grounds for dissolution and proposed different access arrangements for their children the court dismissed the claim for ownership of the audi recognized the personal debts of the plaintiff and ordered the defendant to pay maintenance and damages the court also addressed the division of property and allocation of costs the court granted the dissolution of the marriage with the applicant retaining his surname and the defendant keeping her married name the defendant was ordered to transfer ownership of her vehicles to the applicant who was granted the right to use a vehicle under a joint obligation the court recognized an obligation for the applicant to repay a debt to the employment service and for the defendant to pay fines to the state tax inspectorate the remaining parts of the claim were dismissed and the state will bear the costs of the proceedings
